intro: Ophiorrhiza rufinervis, commonly known as the red-veined ophiorrhiza, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its roots are fibrous and often form dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization. The leaves have distinct reddish veins, which are a key identifying feature of the species.
